name: harden
content:
harden verb [I or T]
(SOLID)
Add to word list
Add to word list
to become or make hard: The mixture hardens as it cools. It is thought that high cholesterol levels in the blood can harden the arteries (= make them thicker and stiffer, causing disease).

harden verb [I or T]
(SEVERE)
to become more severe, determined, or unpleasant: Living in the desert hardened the recruits (= made them more strong and determined). As the war progressed, attitudes on both sides hardened (= became more severe and determined).

harden verb [I/T]
(BECOME SOLID)
to become firm or solid, or to cause something to become firm or solid: [ I ] In a few hours the cement will harden.
Add to word list
Add to word list
if prices or share prices harden, they increase: If the oil price hardens this week and remains high, there will be some effect on fuel prices by the end of this week. The pharmaceuticals company hardened 33p at £26.07 on speculation of predatory interest from a Swiss firm.
